text.0:
A photo shared on Facebook claiming to show Kenya's Deputy President William Ruto smoking a cigarette is ALTERED.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: The photo has been manipulated, and the original image does not have a cigarette in it: https://t.co/DmKp7MzsXE
text.1:
A claim that Nigeria’s Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala has been selected as director-general of the @wto is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:briefcase: Dr Okonjo-Iweala and Yoon Myung-Hee have made the final shortlist for the position and now enter the final round of the selection process: https://t.co/UzAgQ5t0Bz
text.2:
A claim that the High Court of Kenya has suspended the partial reopening of schools until a case filed by activist Okiya Omtatah is heard is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: When the claim was made, there had not been an official announcement about a suspension: https://t.co/6dFY1V4sEC
text.3:
A claim made on Facebook saying that Kenya's Education ministry rescinded the decision to reopen schools on October 12 is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:woman_teacher_medium-dark_skin_tone: At the time the claim was made, the ministry said the decision to reopen schools in phases had not changed: https://t.co/ERerzSQq4A
text.4:
An image of tweets claiming a recent poll has predicted Tanzania’s incumbent president, John Magufuli, will win the ongoing election by 82% is MISLEADING.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: Those Twitter accounts do not exist, and no such a poll was released: https://t.co/7WsBTMusvC

#TanzaniaDecides2020
text.5:
A Facebook post with a screenshot of a @CNN broadcast claiming that Uganda’s President Yoweri Museveni has changed his name due to pressure is PARTLY FALSE.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: The story is misleading and the screenshot was doctored: https://t.co/4EndVMCL6X
text.6:
A Facebook post claiming the US has issued a statement threatening to revoke the visa of Kenya's president is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:page_facing_up: The statement cited in the claim does not mention President Kenyatta or Kenya: https://t.co/NTJgCdmJri
text.7:
A claim that Kenya's National Security Advisory Council has banned all political gatherings organised by the deputy president is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: No such ban has been issued, but the NSAC says police should be notified three days ahead of any political rally: https://t.co/wnw8Qo3mhd
text.8:
A post with an image showing the front page of the @StandardKenya from October 10, 2020 is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: The publication has disowned the image, and the legitimate front page has a different lead story: https://t.co/NYykhw5oLu
text.9: For all those 'Safaricom@20 Anniversary Prize' messages circulating on WhatsApp, @PesaCheck has a guide on how to spot and avoid scams online and on messaging platforms. https://t.co/2ESH1X3KVR
